version_name: 3.2 (ios)This update includes the following new features:-Official Twitter streams have been added for Evening News

version_description:
What's New in Version 3.2 (ios)

This update includes the following new features:

-Official Twitter streams have been added for Evening News, This Morning, 60 Minutes, 48 Hours, Face the Nation, and Sunday Morning.
-Breaking News alerts notify you of the latest news while using the app.
-Reorderable menu items.

Bug Fixes and Improvements:

-CBS News radio no longer turns on randomly.
-Social share ability has been improved.
-Updated ability to turn push notification on or off from within the user settings.
-Updated ability to turn quick read on or off from within the user settings.
-Added drop down menus to each of the CBS News shows.
-Fixed the clickable link issue for articles on iPad

Fixed issues with Push Notification crashes.
Fixed issues with live video crashing.
This build fixes various lingering bugs and adds closed captioning support in the CBSN live stream.
Bug fixes for CBSN live experience.

This version of CBS News app fixes several CBSN video player related bugs and crashes including:

> Recent CBSN segment once again automatically roll to the next segment in the live video experience.
> Crash that occurred when users tap on the CBSN menu after app resumed has been fixed.
> CBSN video headlines are no longer truncated in the Recent menu.
> LIVE indicator is now showing up again after transition from recent clip to CBSN live video.
> CBSN User Interface is no longer broken in iPhone 6 devices.
> Miscellaneous UI improvements in CBSN video player experience.

Updated CBSN Live experience. Watch live, latest and trending videos from your mobile device.
Access all CBS News Newsletters from the main menu.
iOS spotlight search integration.
Updated video player user Interfaces.
Fixed bugs and crashes.

Closed Captioning: To enable/disable closed captioning in CBSN live streaming, please go into Apple Settings > General > Accessibility > Media > Subtitles & Captioning and enable closed captions.
Fixed video player audio bug: Users can now watch CBS News live, vod, and dvr clips with the silent switch on.
Bug fixes for article content disappearing and video player sound issues.

Bug fixes
Added a new Moneywatch "trending" section
Bug fixes.

Stay on top of live and breaking news with our new iOS 10 home screen widget. Add it by swiping right on your lock screen, selecting edit at the bottom of widget screen, and selecting CBS News.

Chromecast support now available for CBSN Live video.

New Moneywatch "Trending" section.

Bug fixes and improvements to app stability and security.

CBS News is now available on Apple Watch.
- Get breaking news notifications
- Browse through the latest headlines
- Handoff to continue reading the full stories on your iPhone
- Bookmark to save stories and read them later
Performance optimizations.

version_description: Performance optimizations
Performance optimization
Performance optimization

- Expanded Chromecast support
- Performance optimizations
Performance optimization

The new and improved CBS News app features a fresh design, creating a seamless navigation and content discovery experience for all users.

With the CBS News app, you can:
• Watch CBSN, a 24/7 live news stream from CBS News. CBSN has live anchored coverage, original reporting, and breaking news in an innovative interactive video experience. No cable subscription required.
• Get real-time updates of evolving and breaking news stories throughout the day.
• Use on-demand to view past segments on topics that interest you the most.
• Receive breaking news push notifications.
• View the latest business headlines and market info from CBS MoneyWatch.
• Share interesting stories with your friends and family via email, Facebook, YouTube, Twitter and Instagram.

New features:
• Stream live coverage from CBS Sports HQ, ET Live, and CBSN New York in the dedicated live stream section
• Dynamic font size for an improved user experience
• Airplay capabilities
• iPad only- picture in picture
• iPad only- split screen capabilities for multitasking
